column1: Book|A book is a series of pages assembled for easy portability and reading
column2: as well as the composition contained in it. The book's most common modern form is that of a codex volume consisting of rectangular paper pages bound on one side
column3: with a heavier cover and spine
column4: so that it can fan open for reading.|[bʊk]|EN

column1: Chairman|The chairman is the highest officer of an organized group such as a board
column3: or a deliberative assembly. The person holding the office is typically elected or appointed by the members of the group.|[ˈtʃɛːmən]|EN

column2: tension may be described as the pulling force transmitted axially by the means of a string
column6: or by each end of a rod

column2: fluffy staple fiber that grows in a boll
column4: around the seeds of the cotton plants of the genus Gossypium in the mallow family Malvaceae. The fiber is almost pure cellulose. Under natural conditions
column5: the cotton bolls will increase the dispersal of the seeds.|[ˈkɑt.n]|EN

column1: Printing|Printing is a process for reproducing text and images using a master form or template. The earliest non-paper products involving printing include cylinder seals and objects such as the Cyrus Cylinder and the Cylinders of Nabonidus. The earliest known form of printing as applied to paper was woodblock printing
column2: which appeared in China before 220 A.D.|[ˈpɹɪntɪŋ]|EN
